decks.notes: This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive gameplay by utilizing low-cost, high-damage creatures and spells to overwhelm opponents quickly. The key strategy is to maintain a steady flow of creatures onto the battlefield, supported by spells like Infuriate and Monstrous Rage to deal additional damage and push through blockers. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds consistency to the deck by allowing for additional mana generation. By maintaining a relentless assault and utilizing efficient removal spells, this deck aims to take control of the game early and outpace opponents.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures like Ghitu Lavarunner and Monastery Swiftspear, while using burn spells like Wizard's Lightning and Play with Fire to clear the way for attacks. With Jegantha, the Wellspring as a Companion, the deck also gains access to additional mana acceleration. This deck aims to apply consistent pressure on the opponent, utilizing efficient creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly and close out games before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on creating a powerful synergy between creatures and lands, manipulating the board to set up devastating combos. By utilizing companion Keruga, the Macrosage, players are able to draw additional cards while maintaining a high mana curve thanks to the deck's restrictions. With cards like Trumpeting Carnosaur and Horned Loch-Whale, players can control the battlefield and overwhelm opponents. Clever Impersonator and Spark Double provide versatility and duplication of key creatures, while the land base supports the deck's overall strategy. The goal is to outvalue opponents and win through incremental advantages gained through intelligent land and creature plays.

This Sultai Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a combination of hand disruption spells like Duress and Thoughtseize, removal spells like Fatal Push, and card draw spells like Treasure Cruise. By efficiently controlling the board and hand, the deck seeks to out-value opponents with powerful late-game threats like Picklock Prankster and Fallaji Archaeologist. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an additional element of consistency and flexibility to the deck. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure the deck can consistently cast its spells and activate abilities.
